data.title: Chocolate bar cutting
data.statement:
Given the dimensions of a chocolate bar, output how many different rectangles you can make using the chocolate squares. Rectangles must use only full squares and be in one piece. Two different rectangles may have the same dimensions, as long as they don't include the same set of chocolate squares.

Example : 2×3
□□□
□□□

□ rectangles of size 1×1 : 6

□□ rectangles of size 1×2 : 4

□ rectangles of size 2×1 : 3
□

□□□ rectangles of size 1×3 : 2

□□ rectangles of size 2×2 : 2
□□

□□□ rectangles of size 2×3 : 1
□□□

total : 18
data.stubGenerator:
read w:int h:int
write total number of rectangles
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> two space-separated integers [[w]] and [[h]], the dimensions of the chocolate bar.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> an integer, the total number of rectangles you can make.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given the dimensions of a chocolate bar, output how many different rectangles you can make using the chocolate squares. Rectangles must use only full squares and be in one piece. Two different rectangles may have the same dimensions, as long as they don't include the same set of chocolate squares.

Example : 2×3
□□□
□□□

□ rectangles of size 1×1 : 6

□□ rectangles of size 1×2 : 4

□ rectangles of size 2×1 : 3
□

□□□ rectangles of size 1×3 : 2

□□ rectangles of size 2×2 : 2
□□

□□□ rectangles of size 2×3 : 1
□□□

total : 18
Input
Line 1 : two space-separated integers w and h, the dimensions of the chocolate bar.
Output
Line 1 : an integer, the total number of rectangles you can make.
Constraints
1 ≤ w, h ≤ 40
Example
Input
2 3
Output
18
